excerpt: Lobster soup, stew & paella, plus a house cheesecake, in a whitewashed venue with al fresco tables.
detail_description: Es Cranc is a renowned seafood restaurant situated in the charming fishing village of Fornells, located in the northern part of Menorca. The restaurant takes pride in its fresh catch of the day, often served grilled and sourced directly from local boats. However, Es Cranc is best known for its specialty lobster dishes, with a large lobster tank ensuring exceptional freshness.
name: Es Cranc
address: Carrer de ses Escoles, 31, 07748 Fornells, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Seasonally inspired plates & tasting menus served in a chic, minimalist dining space with a patio.
detail_description: Smoix Restaurant is a chic and minimalist dining space located in the heart of Ciutadella, offering seasonally inspired plates and tasting menus. The restaurant, situated within the Hotel Rural Sant Ignasi, provides a modern Mediterranean cuisine experience under the direction of chef Miguel Sanchez. Guests can enjoy a unique gastronomic experience surrounded by the beauty of gardens and terraces in an eighteenth-century manor estate.
name: Smoix Restaurant
address: Hotel Rural Sant Ignasi, Ronda Nord, s/n, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurant Café Balear, originally a humble tavern in the 1970s, has become a culinary gem on the island. The Rosa Santa Primera fishing vessel delivers fresh catch exclusively for the restaurant's menu. The seasonal offerings include tapas and meat dishes sourced from locally fed livestock. Depending on the daily catch, patrons can savor the bogavante lobster, known as the largest edible crustacean in the Mediterranean.
name: Restaurant Cafè Balear
address: Passeig des Moll, 15, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Tasting menu of locally sourced, market-fresh fare served in an elegant, whitewashed ambiance.
detail_description: Restaurant Es Tast de na Sílvia in Ciutadella offers a unique dining experience with its locally sourced, market-fresh tasting menu served in an elegant and whitewashed ambiance. Chef Silvia Anglada is dedicated to showcasing the slow and humble essence of Menorcan food, using traditional recipes from a 1704 Menorcan cookbook. The restaurant holds the distinction of being the only one in the Balearic Islands with Slow Food and Km.0 certification.
name: Restaurant Es Tast de na Sílvia
address: Carrer de Santa Clara, 14, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: S'Amarador is a charming restaurant located in Ciutadella, offering traditional sharing plates with picturesque views of the quaint harbor. The menu features mouthwatering seafood dishes and an impressive wine selection. Situated within the Gran Melia, this establishment is known for its famous lobster stew and other delicious offerings. Guests can enjoy local specialties while overlooking the ocean in a beautiful setting.
name: S'Amarador
address: Urbanización Santo Tomás, s/n, 07749 Santo Tomas, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Sa Pedrera des Pujol is a charming restaurant nestled in the exclusive rural hamlet of Torret, Sant Lluis. Since its acquisition in 2003, the current owners have lovingly transformed this establishment into a beautiful space that exudes the rustic charm reminiscent of traditional Menorcan country houses while incorporating modern touches. The ambiance here is inviting and warm, making it a standout destination for those seeking an authentic dining experience on the island.
name: Sa Pedrera des Pujol
address: Camí des Pujol, 14 Entrada por el Km.6 de la Carretera que va a Punta Prima, Camí des Pujol, 14, 07711 Sant Lluís, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Sa Llagosta is a renowned restaurant located in the charming seaside village of Fornells, Menorca. It stands out as one of the top recommendations by local seafood enthusiasts. The restaurant's proximity to the water ensures that guests enjoy fresh and delectable seafood dishes. Specializing in lobster cuisine, Sa Llagosta offers a must-try dish called caldereta menorquina, a stew highly praised by celebrity Chef Jose Andres.
name: Sa Llagosta Restaurant
address: Carrer de Gabriel Gelabert, 12, 07748 Fornells, Illes Balears, Spain

detail_description: Restaurant Ses Forquilles is a beloved tapas spot in the heart of the city, known for its homestyle dishes and affordable prices. Originally located on Rovellada de Dalt, it has now found a new home within the Cristine Bedfor boutique hotel. The restaurant maintains its local charm and is popular among locals for weekday lunches.
name: Restaurant Ses Forquilles
address: Carrer de San Fernando, 12, 07702 Mahón, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Torralbenc is a boutique hotel and vineyard in Menorca, offering a prime location for wine tastings. Visitors can explore the property's grounds to learn about its wine production before indulging in a tasting experience featuring a selection of exquisite vintages paired with local charcuterie, cheese, bread, and olive oil. The hotel's restaurant showcases the island's culinary delights, incorporating local langoustines and sobrassada into their dishes.
name: Restaurante Torralbenc
address: Ctra. Mao, Km.10, 07730 Cala en Porter, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurante Pan y Vino, located in the charming town of Sant Lluis, offers a unique dining experience with its ever-changing menu based on seasonal produce from the local market. The cuisine is a delightful fusion of contemporary French and Mediterranean flavors, with influences from around the world. Run by chef Patrick James, this French-Mediterranean gem is housed in a quaint old farmhouse and provides an intimate and romantic atmosphere for diners to enjoy.
name: Restaurant Pan y Vino
address: Camí Coixa, 3, 07711 Torret, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Elegant, creative takes on traditional island cuisine in a light-filled room or a shaded patio.
detail_description: Rels Restaurant Menorca is a culinary gem located in Ciutadella, where the artistry of traditional island cuisine meets modern creativity. Under the expert guidance of Chef Joan Bagur, who has honed his skills in prestigious Michelin-starred kitchens, Rels offers an exquisite dining experience that showcases the rich flavors of Menorca. The restaurant features a bright and airy interior as well as a charming shaded patio for al fresco dining.
name: Rels Restaurant Menorca
address: Carrer de Sant Isidre, 33, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Simple Spanish starters & fish dishes served in a charming, cliffside tavern with bay views.
detail_description: Cap Roig is a charming cliffside tavern in Cala Sa Mesquida, offering stunning bay views and serving simple Spanish starters and fresh fish dishes. Since 1983, this restaurant has been a favorite among locals and visitors alike. The chic yet unpretentious atmosphere, combined with sun-dappled coastal views, creates an inviting dining experience. The menu focuses on seafood, featuring Menorcan lobster specialties, Galician octopus, fisherman-style monkfish, and local rice dishes.
name: Cap Roig
address: Carrer Gran de sa Mesquida, 13, 07701 Sa Mesquida, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Historic fish market now including vendors serving traditional "pintxos" tapas, sandwiches & wine.
detail_description: The Mercat des Peix is a historic fish market in Mahon, Menorca, offering traditional "pintxos" tapas, sandwiches, and wine. The market is part of the vibrant local scene with its charming colonial architecture and open-air boat trips. Adjacent to the market is the Mercat des Claustre, a food and craft market where visitors can sample local products at tapas bars.
name: Mercat des Peix
address: Pl. de España, 1, 07701 Maó, Illes Balears, Spain

name: Pintarroja Menorca
address: Carrer Moll d'en Pons, 10, 07720 Es Castell, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Paella & classic seafood dishes in a restaurant set into a cave, opening onto a waterfront terrace.
detail_description: I recommend reserving a table to have first access to the water and thus be able to dine, as was the case for us, observing sunset. We tried the black rice, truly a delight. Without a doubt, it is an exceptional place both for its location and food.
name: Restaurant Sa Nacra
address: Carrer de Sa Nacra, Santandría - Sa Caleta. Ciutadella de Menorca. 07760, 07769 Ciudadela, Spain

excerpt: Cozy restaurant with colorful decor & eclectic artwork, known for its paella, seafood & craft beer.
detail_description: Restaurant Es Molí de Foc is a charming eatery located in the village of Sant Climent, known for its vibrant decor and eclectic artwork. The restaurant specializes in exquisite rice dishes, particularly paella and seafood preparations. The establishment also boasts a craft beer factory, offering patrons the opportunity to savor homemade brews alongside their meals. With a focus on contemporary Menorcan cuisine, this rustic setting provides an ideal backdrop for enjoying flavorful dishes and exploring the local culinary scene.
name: Restaurant Es Molí de Foc
address: Carrer de Sant Llorenç, 65, 07712 Sant Climent, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: Restaurant es Molí d'es Racó is a charming eatery located in an old windmill at the west end of Es Mercadal, offering a delightful setting for enjoying typical local cuisine. The restaurant's fortress-grade, whitewashed stone walls and low vaulted ceilings create a unique atmosphere that attracts both locals and visitors.
name: Restaurant es Molí d'es Racó
address: Carrer de la Verge del Toro, 1, 07740 Es Mercadal, Illes Balears, Spain

excerpt: Low-key restaurant offering tapas, rice dishes, & other classic fare, plus cooking classes.
detail_description: Nestled in the charming old town of Ciutadella, Cuk-Cuk is a hidden gem that transcends the typical dining experience. This low-key restaurant specializes in delightful tapas and traditional rice dishes, but what truly sets it apart are its immersive cooking classes. Imagine learning to whip up an authentic paella after a day of hiking—it's not just about food; it's about creating lasting memories!
name: Cuk-Cuk
address: Carrer de Sant Pere d'Alcàntara, 13, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Balearic Islands, Spain

detail_description: After exploring the scenic attractions of Es Castell, consider dropping by Rojo Pomodoro, an Italian restaurant that offers a delightful selection of traditional Italian cuisine. With an emphasis on using fresh and wholesome ingredients, their dishes and pizzas are sure to captivate your taste buds. It is recommended to save some room for dessert as well! Managed by two Italians, Rojo Pomodoro serves delectable thin-crust pizzas made from homemade dough, Napolese tomatoes, and local mozzarella.
name: rojo pomodoro - pizzeria italiana
address: Carrer Sant Josep, 7, 07720 Es Castell, Balearic Islands, Spain

excerpt: Grilled meats, paellas & seafood in an elegant 19th-century barn with sandstone vaults.
detail_description: Molí des Comte - Asador is a unique restaurant located in an elegant 19th-century barn with sandstone vaults. Originally a disused mill, it was repurposed into an art gallery before transforming into a restaurant. The cuisine specializes in grilled meats, paellas, and seafood with a particular focus on Mediterranean flavors. The house specialties include exquisite grilled meats and roasts.
name: Molí des Comte - Asador
address: Av de la Constitución, 22, 07760 Ciutadella de Menorca, Illes Balears, Spain
